result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Tori A. Devito was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees. 
** Pay fine  and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

timeConds.notes: TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.  Huber allowed.  7 days credit.  Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Ward.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 2 is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions; 45 days conditional jail w/Huber privileges; credit for 7 days served; deft taken into custody from court; $1,494.00 total fine/costs (including IID surcharge), bond applied, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster; 24 month revocation of DL; IID; OWI assessment.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Ward.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Ward states the deft completed treatment but the case is not resolved, would like a DA PTC.  DA PTC 1/16/15 at 1:30pm and FPT 2/18/15 at 9am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Ward.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Ward states the deft's treatment is due to complete in December.  FPT continued to 1/8/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
Atty Ward appeared at 8:30am stating that the deft thought her hearing was at 1pm.  Court resets time of hearing to 1:30pm.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

153pm
  Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney John Ward.  Clerk LE.  Not guilty pleas entered to Amended Complaint.  DAPT on 8/1/14 @ 115.  FPT on 9/10/14 @ 830.  Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial on September 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 1, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
2nd - 3rd offense.
Executed search warrant filed on 4/14/14 transferred from 14GF4000x.

133 p.m.  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody with Atty J Ward. Clk LE.  Referred to Comm Mason for further dispo on 7/10/14 @ 1 p.m.  Deft is in halfway house in Il.  Adjourn 30 days.  State has filed amended complaint which makes this a misdemeanor, but deft must be present to enter a plea.
OWI- 3rd

125 p.m.  ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  No appearance by deft.  Atty J Ward.  Referred to Comm Mason for further dispo on 6/10/14 @ 1 p.m.  Deft is in in-patient treatment facility.  Parties agree to adjourn.  Bond - continued posted.
Further proceedings on June 10, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. John A. Ward. Clerk LE. Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing this morning. The State requests adjournment, as they are waiting for records from IL to determine which offense OWI this will actually be. Atty. Ward does not oppose adjournment. Time limits waived by def.  Status conference on 5-13-14 @ 1:00pm. Bond amended to $1500 cash with the same conditions.
Atty  J Ward.

Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Comm Mason on 4/17/14 @ 915am.  Atty Ward moves to strike case as felony.  Motion denied.  $3500  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).
